{
    "number": 182656,
    "data": "1,2,5,10,12,19,20,22,24,25,29,34,36,38,39,41,43,45,46,50,51,53,55,58,60,62,64,65,67,69,71,72,74,76,77,79,81,83,84,86,88,90,91,93,95,96,98,100,102,103,105,107,109,110,112,114,116,117",
    "name": "Floor-sum sequence of r, with r=sqrt(3), and a(1)=1, a(2)=2.",
    "comment": [
        "Let S be the set generated by these rules:  (1) if m and n are in S and m<n, then floor(mr+nr) is in S; (2) two or more specific numbers are in S.  The floor-sum sequence determined by (1) and (2) results by arranging the elements of S in strictly increasing order.",
        "Let B be the Beatty sequence of r. Then a floor-sum sequence of r is a subsequence of B if and only if a(1) and a(2) are terms of B."
    ],
    "example": [
        "a(3)=floor(r+2r)=5."
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A182653, A182654, A182655, A022838."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_Clark Kimberling_, Nov 26 2010",
    "references": 3,
    "revision": 7,
    "time": "2012-03-30T18:57:12-04:00",
    "created": "2010-11-26T13:01:27-05:00"
}
